propositions.text: Family discord deeply affects the child’s emotional state and academic pressure.
Parents’ expectations for the child’s academic success create additional stress.
Parental arguments and coldness lead to the child’s feelings of helplessness.
A sudden misunderstanding at school leads to an emotional outburst.
The child mistakes a stranger for their mother and reacts violently.
The misunderstanding is resolved, but the child’s anger persists.
Inner turmoil and painful memories dominate the child’s thoughts.
The child struggles with loneliness and questions their destiny.
A new beginning emerges as the child adapts to independence.
Friendships and small joys help the child find moments of happiness.
Unresolved questions about identity and family history surface.
The child discovers they may not be biologically related to their parents.
Resolution and acceptance come with the truth about the child’s origins.
The child learns that love, not blood, defines family.

concepts.name: Family
concepts.context: Central theme of emotional conflict and identity.

concepts.name: Child
concepts.context: Protagonist experiencing emotional and identity struggles.

concepts.name: Parents
concepts.context: Source of conflict and love in the child’s life.

hierarchy.structure: The document follows a narrative arc from family conflict and emotional turmoil to personal growth and resolution through six chapters.
